title: Santa Monica Beach Cleanup Success
description: Led a community cleanup that removed 847 plastic bottles and 234 bags from a 2-mile stretch of beach. Coordinated with local environmental groups and recruited 45 volunteers through social media outreach.
shortDescription: Removed 847 plastic bottles from Santa Monica Beach
impact: 847 plastic bottles, 234 plastic bags, 156 food containers removed
policyImpact: City council implemented new beach cleanup funding program based on our data
researchContribution: Data contributed to UCLA's marine debris study
longTermBenefits: Inspired monthly community cleanups, reduced beach litter by 60%

title: Coral Restoration Project at Channel Islands
description: Participated in a 3-month coral restoration initiative that successfully transplanted 500 coral fragments and established 15 new coral nurseries.
shortDescription: Restored 15 hectares of coral reef ecosystem
impact: 500 coral fragments transplanted, 15 nurseries established, 25 hectares protected
policyImpact: Led to expansion of marine protected area boundaries
researchContribution: Methods published in Marine Biology Journal
longTermBenefits: 80% coral survival rate, increased fish biodiversity by 45%

title: Zero Waste Lifestyle Challenge Success
description: Completed a 6-month zero waste challenge, avoiding 456 single-use plastic items and inspiring 23 friends and family members to join the movement.
impact: 456 single-use plastic items avoided, 23 people inspired to join
researchContribution: Data included in USC's consumer behavior study
longTermBenefits: Family and friends continue plastic-free practices

title: School Ocean Education Program
description: Developed and delivered ocean conservation curriculum to 340 elementary students across 5 schools, reaching 1,200 family members through take-home materials.
impact: 340 students educated, 1,200 family members reached, 5 schools participating
policyImpact: School district adopted ocean conservation as standard curriculum
researchContribution: Evaluated effectiveness of environmental education methods
longTermBenefits: Students report continued conservation behaviors at home

title: Microplastics Research Contribution
description: Collected and analyzed 150 water samples from 30 locations along the coast, contributing crucial data to ongoing microplastics pollution research.
shortDescription: Contributed data to microplastics research study
impact: 150 water samples collected, 30 locations surveyed, data contributed to 2 research papers
policyImpact: Data influenced new water quality regulations
researchContribution: Co-authored publication in Environmental Science & Technology
longTermBenefits: Established baseline data for long-term monitoring

title: Community Plastic Reduction Campaign
description: Organized neighborhood campaign that convinced 15 local businesses to eliminate single-use plastics, preventing an estimated 2,300 plastic items from entering waste stream monthly.
impact: 15 businesses converted, 2,300 plastic items prevented monthly
policyImpact: City passed single-use plastic ban for businesses
researchContribution: Case study featured in business sustainability report
